intro: Pseudosopubia procumbens, commonly known as the prostrate pseudosopubia, is a low-growing shrub native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant features small, narrow leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
